text: The Ordinance of Alsnö () was an act by king Magnus Ladulås of Sweden, probably produced in Alsnö hus in September 1280, giving exemption from land taxation to those nobles who committed to produce a heavy cavalryman to the king's service. This established the frälse, the tax-exempt secular nobility in Sweden. ==See also== * History of Sweden * Adelsö Category:1280s in law Category:Swedish law Category:1280 in Europe Category:13th century in Sweden
title: Ordinance of Alsnö
